Michael Backes, Pascal Berrang, Anne Hecksteden, Mathias Humbert, Andreas Keller, Tim Meyer
C ISPA Center for IT-Security, Privacy and Accountability
miRNAs are a part of epigenetics
miRNAs are small RNA molecules, which regulate most of the human genes i.e., they regulate what a cell does / what type of cell it is
miRNA expression quantifies how much miRNAs are active in a given cell a real-valued number for each miRNA e.g., hsa-let-7a-1: 102

highly influenced by external factors e.g., ageing, diet, childhood development, environmental
chemicals thus, highly variable over time
miRNA expression reflects the health status due to their influence on gene expression
associations between miRNA expression and neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimers),
heart disease, diabetes, majority of cancer types and more to follow

C ISPA Center for IT-Security, Privacy and AccountabilityCountermeasures
Probabilistically sanitizing the miRNA expression profiles Adding noise in a fully distributed, differentially private manner providing epigeno-indistinguishability
Noise drawn according to multivariate Laplacian mechanism e.g., for publishing a dataset used in a study
Hiding non-relevant miRNA expressions (not measuring/publishing) sometimes, randomization is not an option e.g., for making a diagnosis in a hospital Downside: correlations between miRNAs
